ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: how to read and write creative non-fiction, aka communicate the world around us in an inventive and artful way.
Good reading and writing skills
Learned how to emulate new writing styles in my writing and got a chance to move away from academic writing
I felt that my writing improved, and although many of my essays felt rushed, I felt that the whole process of reading/workshopping/writing showed me where I'd like my writing to go.

I learned a lot about writing in general, and also feeling free to express myself in my writing, especially nonfiction writing that related to my own personal experiences. I also learned a lot of important writerly techniques to use in my writing, and how to critically review my own writing and make edits.
I greatly improved my writing and editing skills. I have gained skills in close reading of texts.
Very good creative nonfiction stylistic writing course. I also came out with a couple favorite essayists to read.
Writing skills, expressing my ideas through writing.
I learned so much about writing well, thinking from my audiences perspective, structuring a storyline and exploring an idea deeply
Learned a lot about writing and I felt that my style improved a lot through the course.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
professor and small class size is amazing

readings are super interesting

workload can be a tad high at times (4 essay with revisions)
Very good course

No weaknesses! English 120 is the English course to take! The readings were all very carefully selected, and they each exposed us to new styles of writing and techniques we could implement in our own writing. Feedback on essay drafts was incredible, and Craig clearly wanted to see us grow as writers.

Strengths: lots of space to work. Interesting readings. Workshops were nice touch. 

Weaknesses: Wish some of the tips for better writing had been more concrete. Rhetorical styles, etc..

I think the strengths of this course we're definitely the readings we were assigned and the way the units worked, with peer workshops! These were helpful in that reading other's work helped gain insight into one's one work.
The readings were engaging and appropriately reflected class time. The assignments were interesting and fun.
Occasionally, timing of the drafts was tight, which I feel like could be improved with better scheduling. The content was amazing, though.
The course could be improved if we did fewer reading and more writing during class.
It was great no complaints
Curriculum and short stories we read were amazing and insightful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES! Amazing English class here at Yale, Craig is absolutely phenomenal.
Yes very good!
Yes!! I think my writing improved so much! Revising our own essays and those of our peers helped me learn how to break out of the shell of academic writing.
I would. I am a slow essay writer, and therefore the essays often took me a very long time, but often I had a good time writing them. I thought it was a lot of fun.
Yes! This was a very creative and informative class, and I recommend to anyone who enjoys writing creatively.
Absolutely. This class really helped to develop my writing skills and was very interesting.
Yes! Writing is a skill that can be improved, so to all the STEM majors who are scared of writing, please take this course.
I would recommend this class to other people as it teaches and pushes you to better express your ideas through writing.
Yes! Great prof great class
Absolutely. English 120 is a great class for learning how to improve your writing from high school.
